title: NASA adds Starship to launch contract
summary:
NASA has added SpaceX’s Starship to a contract used for launching agency missions, but the vehicle still has significant work ahead before it can start launching major missions.
The post NASA adds Starship to launch contract appeared first on SpaceNews.

summary:

title: Airbus Awarded £150M Contract for ExoMars Lander Platform
summary:
The European Space Agency and ExoMars prime contractor Thales Alenia Space have awarded Airbus a £150 million (€179.4 million) contract to build the landing platform for Europe’s Rosalind Franklin Mars rover. In April 2024, the European Space Agency (ESA) awarded Thales Alenia Space (TAS) a €522 million contract to replace key components of its ExoMars […]
The post Airbus Awarded £150M Contract for ExoMars Lander Platform appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Spectrum takes flight and clears the launch pad
Isar Aerospace’s first Spectrum launch fails
summary:
The first launch of Isar Aerospace’ Spectrum rocket failed March 30 when the vehicle lost attitude control seconds after liftoff and plummeted to Earth.
The post Isar Aerospace’s first Spectrum launch fails appeared first on SpaceNews.
